alert.note: Alert for Caldwell; Christian; Hopkins (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 06 at 1:37PM EST until further notice by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of western Kentucky, including the following areas, Caldwell, Christian, Hopkins, Lyon, and Muhlenberg. * WHEN...Until 345 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1236 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Storms will be repeating over the same areas. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. Locally higher amounts are possible. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Madisonville, Princeton, Central City, Dawson Springs, Eddyville, Land Between The Lakes Area, Earlington, Nortonville, Mortons Gap, Powderly, Olney, Cobb, Farmersville, Graham, Weir, Greenville, White Plains, Kuttawa, Drakesboro and St. Charles.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
